sn45.84:4.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to the noble eightfold path, or, if it’s already arisen, develops it to perfection like good friendship.
sn45.84:4.2: A mendicant with good friends can expect to
sn45.84:4.3: develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.84:4.4: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.84:4.5: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.84:4.6: and right samādhi culminating in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.84:4.7: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.”
